channel.title: Affordable Laptops
channel.description:
I start an internship in around two months and I have put off buying a new laptop for awhile now. With all my other costs for school the money I have been saving up has taken a hard hit. My last big expense for school is this new laptop. My budget is 350$, and I know for this price I won't get an amazing laptop, but I simply require one that can stream my video reviews at a faster rate than the one I have now, which has a ten second buffer for every 3 seconds of video. I've had my current laptop for 4 years and it has been great up until recently where it started slowing down at an alarming rate. Do you have any suggestions on a laptop which meets my needs and my budget? Any suggestions will be greatly appreciated since i'm not much of a computer wiz.
Basic Requirments:
[ul] [li]Stream videos at a fair rate. (For My Online Video Reviews)
[/li][li]A text editor to allow me to take notes. (Honestly Notepad Would Be Fine For Now)
[/li][li]Preferably a 11 + inch screen, but I could live without it if everything else works.
[/li][li]A VGA socket to allow me to display my notes and watch my video reviews on my TV. (I have the cable)
[/li][/ul]

item.title: Affordable Laptops
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“iz3 legend, post:3, topic:525166”][quote author=Java-RSPS-Noob link=topic=643857.msg4333532#msg4333532 date=1374001506]
For your basic needs:

http://www.bestbuy.com/site/Acer+-+Aspire+V5+Series+11.6%26%2334%3B+Laptop+-+4GB+Memory+-+320GB+Hard+Drive+-+Black/9162115.p?id=1218992518250&skuId=9162115
[/quote]

Thanks for the suggestion! It looks great! Ill definitely keep it in mind while further researching.[/quote]please keep in mind there isn’t an optical drive in it but you didn’t state you needed that.

Read full topic
